1.brief: to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
Elihu, the name of one of Job's friends, and of three Israelites

2.brief: to enclose; hence (in a friendly sense) to crown, (in a hostile one) to besiege; also to wait (as restraining oneself)
properly, to live; by implication (intensively) to declare or show
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic

3.brief: to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
entire (literally, figuratively or morally); also (as noun) integrity, truth
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

5.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
vast, whether in extent (figuratively, of power, mighty; of time, aged), or in number, many
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
vast, whether in extent (figuratively, of power, mighty; of time, aged), or in number, many
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

6.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

7.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to scrape off; by implication, to shave, remove, lessen, withhold
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
to soar, i.e. be lofty; figuratively, to be haughty

8.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to yoke or hitch; by analogy, to fasten in any sense, to join battle
properly, what leaps forth, i.e. flash of fire, or a burning arrow; also (from the original sense of the root) a bond
to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere

a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin

9.brief: properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be strong; by implication, to prevail, act insolently

10.brief: to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

11.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to work (in any sense); by implication, to serve, till, (causatively) enslave, etc.
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
a year (as a revolution of time)
delightful (objective or subjective, literal or figurative)

12.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a missile of attack, i.e. spear; also (figuratively) a shoot of growth; i.e. branch
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
to breathe out, i.e. (by implication) expire
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.

13.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to yoke or hitch; by analogy, to fasten in any sense, to join battle

14.brief: to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
a (quasi) sacred person, i.e. (technically) a (male) devotee (by prostitution) to licentious idolatry

15.brief: to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)

16.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
properly, to prick, i.e. (figuratively) stimulate; by implication, to seduce
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
a descent, i.e. imposition, unfavorable (punishment) or favorable (food); restfulness
a table (as spread out); by implication, a meal
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
the fat; abstractly fatness, i.e. (figuratively) abundance; specifically the (fatty) ashes of sacrifices

17.brief: judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to sustain; by implication, to obtain, keep fast; figuratively, to help, follow close

18.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
properly, to prick, i.e. (figuratively) stimulate; by implication, to seduce
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
properly, a cover, i.e. (literally) a village (as covered in); (specifically) bitumen (as used for coating), and the henna plant (as used for dyeing); figuratively, a redemption-price
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application

19.brief: to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard

20.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to inhale eagerly; figuratively, to cover; by implication, to be angry; also to hasten
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.

21.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.
near, with or among; often in general, to
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select

to be (causatively, make) lofty, especially inaccessible; by implication, safe, strong; used literally and figuratively
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach

23.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise

24.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to grow, i.e. (causatively) to enlarge, (figuratively) laud
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

25.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
a man in general (singly or collectively)
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)

26.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration
a year (as a revolution of time)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to scrape off; by implication, to shave, remove, lessen, withhold
a drop; specifically, an aromatic gum (probably stacte)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

to drip, or shed by trickling
a powder (as beaten small); by analogy, a thin vapor; by extension, the firmament
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

29.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse

illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
